utils.circuitManager module

Circuit level simulation (Lvl 2) manager.

class utils.circuitManager.CircuitManager(circuit, report: bool = False)[source]

Bases: object

Circuit level simulations manager.

atualizar_LETths(delay: bool = False)[source]

Updates the minimal LETs of the circuit.

param bool delay:

Whether the delay will be considered in the simulations.

determinar_LETths(delay: bool = False)[source]

Determines all the minimal LETs of the circuit from all possible configurations.

param bool delay:

Whether or not delay will be taken into consideration.

get_atrasoCC()[source]

Sets the delay of shortest path of the circuit.

run_let_job(_, node, output, input_signals: list, delay: bool) → tuple[source]

Runs a single let job a returns the same let with its minimal current. Method meant to be run cuncurrently

param _:

Important for cuncurrency, dont you dare take it out.

param Nodo node:

Node object where fault originates.

param Node output:

Output where fault propagates to.

param list input_signals:

Signal values of inputs.

param bool delay:

Whether or not delay will be taken into consideration.

returns:

A tuple with the minimal let and the input signals run.

utils.circuito module

Circuit object module. The Circuit object only tracks its nodes, delay, inputs, outputs and Lets. The actual circuit is fully described in the .cir file and simulated by Spice.

class utils.circuito.Circuito(name: str, path_to_circuits: str = 'circuitos', vdd: float | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Circuit object. Tracks its file, relevant nodes and LETs.

Fills the circuit object data from the json file.

Fills the circuit object by parsing the .cir file.

param list[str] inputs:

List of node names to be interpreted as inputs.

param list[str] outputs:

List of node names to be interpreted as outputs.

param list[str] ignore:

Nodes that should be ignored.

Checks whether or not a json file containing the circuit data exists.

returns:

If the json file exists or not.

Sets signals of inputs given its values.

utils.concorrencia module

Concurrent Framework. This is the only module in the project that knows cuncurrency existis, as it should be transparent to other modules. The interface provided is of a function executed multiple times with a queue of its inputs.

class utils.concorrencia.PersistentProcessMaster(func: Callable, jobs: list, backup_prefix: str, work_dir: str = 'circuitos', progress_report: Callable | None = None)[source]

Bases: ProcessMaster

Specialization of ProcessMaster that also backups jobs in its routine.

check_backup() → bool[source]

Checks whether of not a backup exists.

returns:

A boolean informing whether or not said backup exists.

delete_backup()[source]

Deletes backups.

dump_backup()[source]

Dumps all jobs into backup files.

empty_queue(queue: Queue)[source]

Emptys a queue.

param mp.Queue queue:

Queue to be emptied.

load_backup()[source]

Loads jobs from backup.

load_jobs(jobs: list)[source]

Alternative for passing jobs in the construction of the object.

param list jobs:

List containing jobs to be done.

master_routine()[source]

Routine of Process Master, including sleeping, reporting progress and backuping.

class utils.concorrencia.ProcessFolder(dir: str)[source]

Bases: object

Context manager that creates a directory for a process that is a copy of the circuits directory. These copys are created in the work directory. As the context manager is exited said folder is deleted.

class utils.concorrencia.ProcessMaster(func: Callable, jobs: list, work_dir: str = 'circuitos', progress_report: Callable | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Handles the multiple workers, jobs and sync.

master_routine()[source]

Routine of Process Master, including sleeping, reporting progress and finishing parallel execution.

post_result(output, id: int, total_time: float)[source]

Posts the output of a function. Called by workers.

param output:

Output of the function.

param int id:

Id of the job completed.

param float total_time:

Time taken to complete the job.

request_job()[source]

Returns a single job to be executed. If there are no jobs left returns -1. Called by workers.

returns:

A job or -1

return_done()[source]

Returns all completed jobs.

returns:

Complete jobs.

smart_sleep()[source]

Sleeps for a variable amount of time depending on the time workers post jobs.

terminate_work(workers: list)[source]

Terminates all the Process Workers.

work(static_args: list, n_workers: int = 12)[source]

Creates all workers and runs all workers.

param list static_args:

List containing the static arguments of the jobs, that dont change in between jobs.

param int n_workers:

Number of workers to be created, will take the cpu count as standard.

class utils.concorrencia.ProcessWorker(work_func: Callable, static_args: list, max_work: int, work_dir: str = 'circuitos')[source]

Bases: object

Executes some function multiple times with different inputs. The static_args+job define the inputs.

run(master: object) → None[source]

Executes multiple jobs and posts its results.

param object master:

Process Master.

utils.graph module

Graph Module. Used to model wich nodes of a circuit can propagate a fault to.

class utils.graph.Graph(transistors: list, ignore: list)[source]

Bases: object

Graph object.

my_reach(source: str, already_seen: set | None = None) → set[source]

Returns a set with the names of all vertices the source can see.

sees(source: str, target: str, already_seen: set | None = None) → bool[source]

Returns whether or not source node sees the target. (DPS)

param str source:

Source og the search.

param str target:

Target of the search.

param str already_seen:

A list of already seen vertices, used by recursive call.

utils.letFinder module

Module with LetFinder a Level 1 simulation responsible for calculating the minimal Let for a fault given some parameters.

class utils.letFinder.LetFinder(circuit, path_to_folder: str = 'circuitos', report: bool = False)[source]

Bases: object

Responsible for finding the minimal LET value from a faulted node to an output.

definir_current(let: LET, input_signals: list, safe: bool = False, delay: bool = False) → tuple[source]

Returns the minimal current of a modeled Set to propagate a fault from the node to the output.

param LET let:

Let modeled including node and output.

param list input_signals:

Logical value of each input.

param bool False:

Whether the Let is already known to be valid.

param bool delay:

Whether the delay of the circuit will be taken into consideration.

returns:

A tuple containing the simulation number and the current found, if any.

utils.logicValueFinder module

Module with LogicValue a Level 1 simulation responsible for finding the logical values of nodes given an input

utils.mcManager module

class utils.mcManager.MCManager(circuit, delay: bool = False)[source]

Bases: object

Responsible for Monte Carlo simulations.

analise_monte_carlo_total(n_analysis: int, continue_backup: bool = False, delay: bool = False, progress_report=None)[source]

Runs the full Monte Carlo simulation and puts the results in <path>/<circuit_name>_mc_LET.csv.

param int n_analysis:

Number of MC analysis.

param bool continue_backup:

Whether or not the simulation should continue from a backup if one exists.

param bool delay:

Whether or not delay should be taken into consideration.

param Callable progress_report:

Optional function that progress can be reported to.

returns:

Nothing, puts data in <path>/<circuit_name>_mc_LET.csv.

run_mc_iteration(index: int, point: list, delay: bool = False)[source]

Runs a single Monte Carlo simulation.

param int index:

Id of the simulation.

param list point:

A tuple of floats in the format (pmos, nmos)

utils.spiceInterface module

Spice Interface. The interaction with Spice is always done through SpiceRunner. No other file in the Project should know how to interact with Spice. Both classes in this file are stateless, therefore the classes are instantiated and its instances are accessed

class utils.spiceInterface.SpiceFileManager(path_to_folder: str = 'circuitos')[source]

Bases: object

Responsible for altering the .cir files used by Spice and reading its output.

get_delay() → float[source]

Reads the delay measured from the output.txt file.

returns:

the delay measured.

get_mc_faults(circuit_name: str, sim_num: int, inclination: str, vdd: float) → int[source]

Returns the number of simulations that resulted in a fault in a MC simulation.

param str circuit_name:

Name of the circuit.

param int sim_num:

Number of Monte Carlo simulations done.

param str inclination:

Inclination of fault on the output. Must be ‘rise’ or ‘fall’.

param float vdd:

Vdd of the simulations.

returns:

Number of simulations that faulted.

get_mc_instances(circ_name: str) → dict[source]

Reads the instances in <circuit>.mc0.csv.

param str circ_name:

Name of the circuit.

returns:

Dict containing the instances of variability.

get_nodes(circuit_name: str, ignore: list) → set[source]

Parse a <circut_name>.cir file and gets all nodes connected to transistor devices.

param str curcuit_name:

name of the circuit to be parsed.

returns:

a set containing the label of all nodes and a Graph object.

param list[str] ignore:

Nodes that should be ignored.

get_nodes_tension(nodes: list) → dict[source]

Reads the max and min tension of given nodes

param list[str] nodes:

List of node names to be retrieved.

returns:

a dict in the form {node: (min_tension, max_tension)}

get_output() → dict[source]

Reads data in the output.txt file.

returns:

a dict containing all data formatted as {‘label’: data}

get_peak_tension(inclination: str, nodMeas: bool = False) → float[source]

Reads the peak tension of a node.

param str inclination:

Inclination measured. Must be ‘rise’ or ‘fall’

param bool nodMeas:

Node measured is an output = False; is not an output = True.

returns:

peak tension measured.

get_tension() → tuple[source]

Reads the max and min tension of a node

returns:

A tuple containing the max and min tensions.

measure_delay(input: str, out: str, vdd: float) → None[source]

Altes the measure.cir file to measure the delay from one input to one output.

param str input:

name of the input node.

param str out:

name of the output node.

param float vdd:

value of the vdd of the simulation.

measure_nodes(nodes: list) → None[source]

Alters the measure.cir file to track the min and max value of given nodes.

param list[str] nodes:

List of node names to be measured.

measure_pulse(node: str, output: str) → None[source]

Alters the measure.cir file to track min and max tension on given node and output

param str node:

Node with to have min and max tensions measured

param str output:

Output to have min and max tensions measured

measure_pulse_width(let: LET) → None[source]

Alters the measure.cir file to measure the fault width of the let on the output. The fault width is the time the output node is flipped by the fault.

param LET let:

let modeled.

measure_tension(node: str) → None[source]

Alters the measure.cir file to track min and max tension on given node.

param str node:

Node with to have min and max tensions measured.

set_monte_carlo(simulations: int = 0) → None[source]

Sets the monte carlo parameter in the monte_carlo.cir file.

param int simulations:

number o Monte Carlo simulations.

set_pulse(let: LET, current: float | None = None) → None[source]

Alters the SETs.cir file wich models the fault.

param LET let:

let to be modeled.

param float current:

current of the fault. If left as None let.current will be used.

set_signals(inputs: dict, vdd: float, vss: float = 0) → None[source]

Alters the fontes.cir file defining the input values of the simulation.

param float vdd:

the vdd of the simulation.

param dict inputs:

dict with input values in the form {input_name: input_value}

Alterts the mc.cir file to set the variability parameters.

param float nvar:

work function of nfer devices.

run_SET(filename: str, let: LET, current: float | None = None, path_to_root='../../../..') → tuple[source]

Returns the peak voltage output for a given let.

param str filename:

Name of the file.

param LET let:

let simulated.

param float current:

current of the fault. If left as None let.current will be used.

param str path_to_root:

path to root directory of the project.

returns:

a tuple containing the peak tension at the node where the fault originated and output.

run_delay(filename: str, input_name: str, output_name: str, vdd: float, inputs: list) → float[source]

Returns the delay of shortest path from a input to and output.

param str filename:

Name of the file.

param str input_name:

Name of the input node from where the delay is propagated.

param str output_name:

Name of the output node where the delay propagates to.

param float vdd:

Vdd of the simulation.

param list inputs:

A list of Entrada objects.

returns:

the delay of shortest path from the input to the output.

run_nodes_value(filename: str, nodes: list) → dict[source]

param str filename:

Name of the file.

param float vdd:

Vdd of the simulation.

param list[str] nodes:

A list of node names to be measured.

returns:

a dict in the form {node: (min_tension, max_tension)}

run_pulse_width(filename: str, let: LET, current: float | None = None) → float[source]

Returns the pulse width of the propagated fault.

param str filename:

Name of the file.

param LET let:

Let to be simulated.

param float current:

current to be simulated. If None then let.current will be used.

returns:

Fault width at output.

Returns the number of MC simulation that faulted.

param str circuit_name:

Name of the circuit.

param str name_name:

Name of the node.

param str output_name:

Name of the output.

param int sim_num:

Number of simulations.

param str output_incl:

Inclination of fault at the output.

param float vdd:

Vdd of the simulation.

return:

The number of simulations that faulted.

test_spice() → None[source]

Testes if spice is working. If not will exit as nothing can be done without spice.
